verse: Then a man will take hold of his brother in his father’s house and say, “You have fine clothing. You be our ruler. You take charge of these ruins.”
But in that day his brother will cry out, “I am not a healer. In my house I have neither bread nor fine clothing. Don’t make me ruler of this people.”

The Lord will enter into judgment with the elders of his people and with their officials. He says, “It is you who have devoured the vineyard. The things you have stolen from the poor are in your houses.
What do you mean by crushing my people and grinding the faces of the poor? declares the Lord, the Lord of Armies.”

header: Judgment on the Proud Women of Jerusalem

verse: The Lord also says this. Because the daughters of Zion are haughty, and they walk with their heads held high, flirting with their eyes, walking seductively with quick little steps, with ornaments jingling on their ankles,
the Lord will crown the heads of the daughters of Zion with scabs. The Lord will make their scalps bald.
In that day the Lord will take away the beautiful anklets, the headbands, the crescent ornaments,
the earrings, the bracelets, the veils,
the headdresses, the ankle chains, the sashes, the perfume bottles, the magic charms,
the signet rings, the nose rings,
the elegant dresses, the capes, the shawls, the purses,
the hand mirrors, the fine linen wraps, the tiaras, and the gowns.
On that day seven women will take hold of one man and say, “We will eat our own bread and wear our own clothing. Just let us be called by your name. Take away our shame.”
